examples.text: The play is both comic and tragic.
She can always be relied on to provide **comic relief** *(= something to make you laugh)* at a boring party.
He wore a red nose and novelty glasses for comic effect.

definitions.definition: connected with comedy (= entertainment that is funny and that makes people laugh)

examples.text: Charlie Chaplin was a comic genius.

wordOrigin: late 16th cent.: via Latin from Greek kōmikos, from kōmos ‘revel’.
